front.title: Adding an Uncacheable File Data Attribute to NFSv4.2

abstract.t: The Network File System version 4.2 (NFSv4.2) allows a client to cache data for file objects. Applications on some clients can control the caching of data, but there is no way to achieve this at a system level. This document introduces a new uncacheable file data attribute for NFSv4.2. Files marked as uncacheable file data SHOULD NOT have their data stored in client-side caches. This document extends NFSv4.2 (see RFC7862).
